content: Try to run Thunderbird in troubleshoot mode: Win >> hold down the Shift key while launching TB Mac >> hold down the Alt (Option) key while launching TB
creator: Mapenzi

content: Depending on how you deleted the account, the message folders may still be there. - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - you are now in the profile. - if the account was IMAP, open the imapmail folder. if POP, then open the mail folder - if your account is shown, then click the account name and your message folders, such as inbox, inbox.msf will appear. - if that is true, let me know and I'll provide next steps.
creator: davidsk

content:
Can I assume you have access to both computers? And that is this a local calendar, not a network calendar like one hosted by Google or other? If so...

In the source computer's calendar list, click the little three-dot indicator to the right of the calendar name, and choose Export Calendar and export it to an ICS file.

Move that file to the destination computer. Choose the menu item (on Windows) <Tools | Import | Import from a file | Continue button | Import Calendars | Continue button> and navigate to your ICS file and choose it. Thunderbird will prompt you through the rest of the process.
creator: rednoise

content:
I suppose that you had used POP accounts in Thunderbird on your old laptop, so Thunderbird on your new laptop can only download the incoming messages which had been left on the server. Since you have professional use of Thunderbird I presume that you regularly made security backups of your Thunderbird profile containing all your data (accounts, folders, messages, address books, ...). Would you like to recover your data from the most recent backup copy?

If you don't have backup copies of your Thunderbird data, try to get help from an IT professional who might recover the hard disk of your old laptop, mount it in a drive and plug it in your laptop.
creator: Mapenzi

content:
Prova anzitutto a spiegare in dettaglio il problema: cosa provi a fare, cosa non funziona e che errori ricevi dal programma.

Più in generale, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire anche queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

creator: davidsk

content:
Be sure you are using the latest version from the Thunderbird Add-Ons site:

https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/deselect-on-delete-tb78/

If you search for "Deselect on Delete" from "Add-ons and Themes" within Thunderbird, you can install it directly from there without manually downloading it. This has an advantage of the site letting you know if the add-on is incompatible with your Thunderbird version, or is perhaps untested or dangerous.

Otherwise, you can install an add-on from an already-downloaded file from (in Windows) menu item <Tools | Add-ons and Themes>, click on the little gear icon and choose "Install add-on from file" and browse to your file and choose it.
creator: rednoise

content:
Are you referring to the primary password? If you forgot it, you can reset it with these steps:


Go to tools>Developer tools>error console - enter this text 

   openDialog("chrome://pippki/content/resetpassword.xhtml")


- the Reset button should appear. All passwords for accounts will be deleted
creator: davidsk

content: Thunderbird is just your agent; if your provider places restrictions, you need to contact them if you seek adjustments.
creator: davidsk

content: IMAP accounts act as IMAP accounts, regardless of the email client. To put IMAP messages on PC and then delete from server,, you must COPY them to local folders to remove their association with the account. And then delete; it is a two-step process. Local Folders are, indeed, independent, but in moving, you do not disconnect from server.
creator: davidsk
